rows.MC CONVERSATION MAP — PER MODEL: 4-10 hours of recorded conversations per model. Here's who the MC talks to and what they cover.

rows.col_4: Core Questions
How does a Trade get built? What does Claude do vs humans? How does expert calibration work? What makes a good vs bad model?
rows.col_5: How-the-sausage-gets-made series. Viewers understand the production system.

rows.col_3: Nilo, PM co-founder, MC reflects on own experience
rows.col_4: How did each person get hired? What was the ask? Why did they say yes? What would they change? How does the chain work?
rows.col_5: Recruiting content. Future hires watch this and self-select.

rows.col_4: What is the coordination hedgefund? Why two companies? What is the DAO structure? Where does the money come from? What is the tech roadmap?
rows.col_5: Investor-grade content. The thesis explained by the founder to a curious outsider.

rows.col_4: Why electrolytes? Why now? Who is the customer? What is the bet? What kills this? What does winning look like?
rows.col_5: Origin story. Why this company exists. The MC pushes back on assumptions.

rows.col_4: Who are we hiring? In what order? How do we find them? What does the operator look like?
rows.col_5: Behind the scenes of building the team.

rows.col_4: Why Delaware? What is the cap table? How does equity work? What does the DAO structure mean legally?
rows.col_5: Demystifying incorporation. MC asks the questions first-time founders have.

rows.col_4: What do the numbers say? Are we going to make money? What are the assumptions? What breaks the model?
rows.col_5: Financial transparency. Numbers explained to a non-finance person.

rows.col_4: How much are we raising? From whom? What do investors get? What is the pitch? What are investors asking?
rows.col_5: Fundraising in real time. Investors watching see radical transparency.

rows.col_4: What is in this product? Why these ingredients? What does the science say? How is this different from LMNT?
rows.col_5: Science content. The MC asks what every consumer wants to know.

rows.col_4: Where does this get made? How long does it take? What can go wrong? How much does it cost?
What can we legally say? What can't we say? What does FDA compliance mean? What do other brands get wrong?
rows.col_5: Compliance explained. Builds trust with sophisticated consumers.

rows.col_4: What does the brand look like? Why these colors? Why this name? What feeling are we going for? How does packaging work?
What tools are we using? How does the store work? What does the customer experience feel like?
rows.col_5: Tech walkthrough. Useful for anyone building D2C.

rows.col_4: How much does it cost? Why that price? What are the margins? How do subscriptions work?
rows.col_5: Pricing transparency. Bold move that builds trust.

rows.col_4: What is a VSL? How does direct response work? What makes a good hook? How do you test?
rows.col_5: DR education content. The MC learns direct response on camera.

rows.col_4: What do the ads look like? How many do we need? What makes an ad work? What is creative testing?
rows.col_5: Ad creative process. Interesting to other founders and marketers.

rows.col_4: Where do ads run? How much do we spend? How do we know if it's working? What is ROAS? What is attribution?
rows.col_5: Media buying demystified. MC asks what every founder wonders.

rows.col_4: How do we know what works? What is A/B testing? How many tests do we run? What does statistical significance mean?
rows.col_5: Experimentation explained. Scientific method applied to ads.

rows.col_4: What does the landing page look like? Why is it structured this way? What converts?
What content do we create beyond ads? How does SEO work for supplements? What is the long game?
What emails do customers get? When? Why? How does segmentation work? What is good open rate?
Walk me through the welcome series. What about abandoned cart? How do win-back flows work?
What is a CRM? How do we track customers? What is LTV? How do cohorts work?
What happens when someone has a problem? How fast do we respond? What is the 11-star experience?
How does subscription work? Why do people cancel? How do we keep them? What is churn?
How do we get customers to tell friends? What is the referral program? How does community work?
How do we work with creators? What do we pay them? How do we find the right ones?
How does the product get to the customer? What is a 3PL? What can go wrong? How fast is shipping?
How do we track money? What is bookkeeping? What reports do we look at? How do we know if we're healthy?
Who are our competitors? What are they doing? Where are we different? What are we worried about?
Who is our customer? What do they care about? What language do they use? What are their objections?
Where do we go after DTC? Amazon? Retail? B2B? International? What is the long-term vision?
How do we get press? What is our story? What if something goes wrong publicly?
What numbers do we look at? How often? What are red flags? What does the dashboard show?
How do we hire? What roles? What do we look for? How do we evaluate people?
What is the school model? What are semesters? What is graduation? How does this apply to business?
rows.col_5: Novel framework explained. Nilo teaches the MC.

rows.col_4: What is a Compliance Manager? Why does grading matter? How does governance work? How is this different from a normal startup?
rows.col_5: Core proprietary framework. Extensive. Nilo's deepest content.

rows.col_4: What is the Trade? Why 842 tabs? How does it all connect? What is the map of maps?
rows.col_5: Meta-content. How the system itself works.

rows.col_4: What does a day look like? A week? A month? How do we stay on track?
What are SOPs? How does knowledge management work? What if someone quits?
How does AI help? What does Claude do? What is automatable? What isn't?
What is coordination theory? What are the games? What is requisite variety? What is an eigenform? Walk me through each framework.
rows.col_5: The intellectual foundation. Multiple episodes. Nilo's philosophy made accessible.

rows.col_4: What is implicate order? How does Bohm apply to business? What is the 75 questions protocol? Why does beauty matter?
rows.col_5: Deep philosophy. The why behind everything. Most unique content.

rows.col_4: How does someone new use this system? What is the command center? Where do you start?
rows.col_5: Onboarding content. New hires watch this first.

rows.MC CONVERSATION MAP — PER MODEL: Total conversation hours across all 44 models: ~212 hours
At 2 sessions/day averaging 2 hours each: ~53 working days = ~10 weeks
These don't all happen at once. They happen as each model enters production.
M0 + S3 conversations happen in Week 1-2 (the thesis and infrastructure).
M2-M4 conversations happen in Week 2-3 (entity, financials, fundraising).
Everything else happens on the production schedule as models get built.
